column5: This has probably been asked 100 times but I guess I don't know the answer. We are going on a fly-in. The guides do all the fish cleaning so they should know the answer to this. Do they have to leave any skin on the filet for identification? Answers appreciated. Thanks

I'm assuming that you're heading to Ontario. If that's the case, the Ontario regulations regarding transportation of fish are available at the web reference below: http://www.mnr.gov.on.ca/MNR/pubs/fi...nfo_fr2004.pdf
